title: Council Directive 76/399/EEC of 6 April 1976 making a fifth amendment to the Council Directive of 23 October 1962 on the approximation of the rules of the Member States concerning the colouring matters authorized for use in foodstuffs intended for human consumption
header:
COUNCIL DIRECTIVE  of 6 April 1976  making a fifth amendment to the Council Directive of 23 October 1962 on the approximation of the rules of the Member States concerning the colouring matters authorized for use in foodstuffs intended for human consumption  (76/399/EEC)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. Annexes I and III to the Directive of 23 October 1962 are amended as follows:
The following colouring matters are deleted as from 1 January 1977:
>PIC FILE= "T9000943">  E 103 Chrysoine S,
E 105 Fast yellow AB,
E 111 Orange GGN,
E 121 Orchil, orcein,
E 125 Scarlet GN,
E 126 Ponceau 6 R,
E 130 Anthraquinone blue (solanthrene blue RS),
E 152 Black 7984,
E 181 Burnt umber.
2. The marketing of foodstuffs containing one or more of the colouring matters listed in paragraph 1 shall be prohibited as from 1 January 1978.  (1)OJ No L 79, 5.4.1976, p. 46. (2)OJ No C 50, 4.3.1976, p. 8. (3)OJ No 115, 11.11.1962, p. 2645/62. (4)OJ No L 157, 18.7.1970, p. 36.

Member States which are authorized to prohibit, until 31 December 1975, the use in foodstuffs of one or more of the colouring matters listed in Article 1 (1) may maintain this prohibition beyond that date.
Member States shall take all measures necessary to comply with this Directive on the dates fixed in Article 1 and shall forthwith inform the Commission thereof.
This Directive is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Luxembourg, 6 April 1976.
For the Council
The President
J. HAMILIUS
